Question: The Avenue **** in Saigon, Vietnam, is one of the few streets in that city to retain its French name.
Hints: This person's death occurred in 1895, near Paris, from complications of a series of strokes that had started in 1868.
Chamberland assumed an error had been made, and wanted to discard the apparently faulty culture when this person stopped him.
Both Institute **** and Université this person were named after him.
